div.bibl: Il Bollettino Sociale, Mar. 3, 1931. ITALIAN-AMERICAN DEMOCRATIC ORGANIZATION

body.p: Under the leadership of Paul V. Colianni, trustee of the sanitary district, the Italian-American Democratic Organization has been founded in order to unite all Italians in support of A. J. Cermak, candidate for the office of Mayor of Chicago, in the election of April 7, 1931.
Meetings are being held at 139 North Clark Street to arrange the program for the political campaign to be conducted in every ward.
Mr. Colianni's co-adjutors are: Attorney Stephen Malato, Judge F. Borrelli, Judge F. B. Allegretti, Judge N. Bonelli, M. A. Rosinia, and many others.
